channel.title: touch on LoopedLine
channel.description: Recent content in touch on LoopedLine

item.title: Automating Bash Shell Commands
item.description: Introduction to automating shell commands There is a lot that can be accomplished efficiently with Bash. After getting started working with Bash you’ll quickly discover commands that you run again and again. For some simple commands you can make them even more convenient by creating a shell alias or a shell function. Other commands involving multiple steps you can typically use and manage more efficiently by creating a shell script.

item.title: Creating Multiple Files with Bash
item.description: Introduction When you want to create multiple files, Bash can help do it efficiently. Below are several examples for creating files. To follow along, navigate to an empty folder where you want to create files and enter the commands. A warning You may wish to remove files after each step, but since the rm command is powerful and can delete more files than you intended without prompting, make sure you understand its use before blindly applying the example commands below.
